article.headline: Wyoming 62, Loyola Marymount 55
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Afam Muojeke scored 19 points and Tyson Johnson added 16 points as Wyoming defeated Loyola Marymount 62-55 on Saturday. Muojeke, the second leading scorer in the Mountain West Conference at 19 points per game, made 7-of-12 shots and scored 16 of his 19 points in the first half. With the scored tied at 51-51 with 4:31 remaining in the game, Johnson and Sean Ogirri each converted four critical free throws down the stretch to help Wyoming (6-1) seal the win. Ogirri scored 10 points for the Cowboys and Brandon Ewing dished out seven assists for Wyoming. Marko Deric tied a career-high with 16 points for the Lions (0-8). Kevin Young had 10 points and 13 rebounds for LMU, who dressed only eight players due to injuries. The Lions shot only 31 percent for the game (21-67), including 4-of-19 3-pointers. LMU has lost 16 games in a row dating back to February 2008 and 27 of 29.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
